title: Surrender way too much in low elo

embed.description: Every game is a story; visit the new League of Legends match history to check out how this one ends and share your own!

body: Just was in game and the game was fairly even though they may have had slight upper hand. No one was working together due to the low elo and suddenly 4 people on my team decided they didn't want to play anymore. I couldn't believe it. Do you guys agree people surrender too easily?

replies.body: How about they just remove the surrender feature? Right now League is about psychologically crushing your opponents into surrender with your devastating snowball.
Definately, especially where theres maybe a two tower difference, or 10 kills. I dont mind surrenders in normals, but in ranked 20mins is way too short for most games to be decided in low elo
people in the games i play never surrender and usually waste an extra 15-20 minutes on an unavoidable loss.

This. 

Some games can be recovered.  Others are just a complete waste of time. You can generally tell which is which by 20 mins.

Personally I believe the  surrender  introduces a level of toxicity into games. 

Whether or not a game is win-able is completely subjective, therefore the statement that you can tell whether or not a game is going to be a waste of time is false. 

Unfortunately the option of surrendering introduces anger to a lot of players who get into the mindset of 'Well I'm not doing great so I don't want to play anymore' 

It amazes me how people can't still view their achievements in a winning game. Great K/D/A based on the circumstances? Did a fantastic job with my CS this match? Wow, this other person was actually pretty good and I could learn from them? These views don't exist and it's a sad element of the game.

I don't like the fact of surrendering in Ranked either. Sure in Norms I can find it somewhat understandable, but in Ranked I don't see the point. I'm not going to say that I've never surrendered because that would be a lie, and I can agree that games do become frustrating sometimes, but the fact remains that **anything can happen**. A game isn't set in stone just because a team has a few more towers or kills, the game is truly decided when a team gives up.
Sometimes people try and predict the game ahead, cannot see a win, and 3 other people agree, so they surrender. It is rather hard counter playing a fed Jax in late game after all.
People go on tilt and decide to surrender. Happens all the time.
